Series.Actors: |Jessica Lange|Sarah Paulson|Evan Peters|Taissa Farmiga|Clea Duvall|Adam Levine|Chloë Sevigny|Joseph Fiennes|Lizzie Brocheré|Zachary Quinto|Lily Rabe|James Cromwell|Alex Breckenridge|Frances Conroy|Connie Britton|Zachary Quinto|Evan Peters|Denis O'Hare|Alexander Dreymon|Angela Bassett|Bodhi Schulz|Britne Oldford|Christine Estabrook|Dylan McDermott|Emma Roberts|Fredric Lehne|Gabourey Sidibe|Jamie Brewer|Jenna Dewan-Tatum|Jessica Lange|Josh Hamilton|Kai Schulz|Kate Mara|Kathy Bates|Matt Ross|Morris Chestnut|Naomi Grossman|Patti LuPone|Riley Schmidt|Teddy Sears|
Series.Overview: American Horror Story is a horror-drama television franchise created and produced by Ryan Murphy and Brad Falchuk. Described as an anthology series, each season is conceived as a self-contained miniseries, following a disparate set of characters and settings, and a storyline with its own "beginning, middle and end".

Episode.EpisodeName: The Murder House: Presented by Eternal Darkness Tours of Hollywood
Episode.Overview: A fake guided tour through the "Murder House," with an overview of the mansion's horrid history. Edited with glitchy abandon.

Episode.EpisodeName: Behind the Fright: The Making of American Horror Story
Episode.Overview: An excellent, nearly half-hour- long behind-the-scenes documentary, featuring interviews with nearly everyone involved and covering the show's creation, the casting, the horror and sexuality, the makeup, the costuming, and more.

Episode.EpisodeName: Overture to Horror: Creating the Title Sequence
Episode.Overview: Main title designer Kyle Cooper and composers Cesar Davila-Irizarry and Charlie Clouser—former Nine Inch Nails keyboardist—break down the work that went into making the creepiest title sequence on television.

Episode.EpisodeName: Out of the Shadows: Meet the House Ghosts
Episode.Overview: Interviews with all the of the ghosts who inhabit the Harmon house.
A short featuring an orderly being interviewed by an unseen woman, leading to disastrous results with Bloody Face.

Episode.EpisodeName: What Is American Horror Story: Asylum?
Episode.Overview: A compendium of interviews and snippets from the season.
Focuses on the series' incredible production design.
Takes us to Tinsley Studios, which does all of the make-up and prosthetics effects.
A therapist and his family move across the country to escape their troubled past but quickly discover that their new home comes with its own horrific baggage.
Vivien and Violet get themselves caught in a dangerous situation. Meanwhile, Ben goes back to Boston to fix a mistake that he made.

Vivien learns the horrific truth about the house's first residents and Ben's visitor causes him to further unravel about what really happened in the haunted house. Constance and Moira have their history revealed.
The line between the living and the dead blurs on Halloween. Two of the house's previous residents give the Harmons decorating advice.
Tate comes face to face with his past, and Ben and Vivien are haunted by a new houseguest before Halloween night comes to an end.
Constance enlists Violet's assistance with Tate. Ben helps a new patient confront his fears.
Moira persuades a buyer to make an offer while Constance and Larry work against her efforts.
The man in the rubber suit is revealed.
One of history's most famous murder victims pays the house a visit. Constance discovers more of Tate's bad behavior.
Violet learns about the rules of the house. The truth about Larry's condition is explained. Constance is interrogated by the police.
Vivien gives birth. Tate and Violet attempt to rid the house of some of its ghosts for good.

In the aftermath of family tragedy, Ben tries to take his child out of the Murder House. Meanwhile, Violet and Vivien accustom themselves to their new living arrangements, Constance raises Tate's child as her own and a new family buys the house.
Terrifying evils blur the boundaries between reality and insanity at the Briarcliff Manor.
An exorcist is called to Briarcliff to help save a troubled farm boy; Sister Jude's darkest secret is revealed.
A violent storm allows a group of patients to plan a daring escape; Sister Jude is haunted by her past.

Episode.GuestStars: |Mark Consuelos|Fredric Lehne|Franka Potente|Matthew John Armstrong|John Lee Ames|
Episode.Overview: A new patient exposes Arden's past; Kit learns why Grace was admitted to Briarcliff.
Sister Jude employs a renowned Nazi hunter to gather evidence against Arden; Kit makes a surprising confession; Bloody Face is unmasked.

Episode.GuestStars: Mark Consuelos|Bob Bancroft|Kirk Bovill|Nikki Hahn|Tara Holt|Kasey Mahaffy|
Episode.Overview: A mysterious little girl is abandoned at Briarcliff; the Monsignor makes a Faustian pact with Dr. Arden; the origin of Bloody Face is revealed.

Episode.GuestStars: Frances Conroy|Fredric Lehne|William Mapother|Erin Allin O'Reilly|Sean Patrick Thomas|
Episode.Overview: Sister Mary Eunice is terrified to discover a dark angel at Briarcliff; Kit makes a bold move to be reunited with Grace.

Episode.GuestStars: Lara Harris|David Hutchison|Cole Sand|Ian McShane|Jennifer Holland|
Episode.Overview: A murderous Santa wreaks havoc on Briarcliff; Sister Jude faces off with the devil; Arden has a shocking encounter in the death chute.
The Monsignor takes an unlikely convert under his wing; Lana secures a new piece of evidence that can exonerate Kit; Dr. Arden witnesses a miraculous return.
The Monsignor confronts the Devil. Dr. Arden’s experiments reach a shocking conclusion. Dr. Thredson facilitates a surprising reunion for Kit.
Grace tells Kit devastating news about the aliens' experiments on Alma; Dr. Thredson receives an unexpected visitor; the Monsignor goes to extreme lengths to silence Jude.
A deadly new inmate threatens Sister Jude's chance of release; Grace's obsession with the aliens turns violent.
Johnny sets out to complete his father's work; Lana leads the charge to finally shut down Briarcliff.
A young girl discovers she possesses a strange genetic affliction tracing back to the dark days of Salem; Fiona Goode returns to town.
Fiona helps Zoe and Madison deal with a horrible tragedy; Delphine LaLaurie struggles to adjust to modern life; Cordelia faces a dark decision about her family.
Fiona takes on an unlikely protégé; a guilt-ridden Zoe tries to give Kyle his old life back; Madison has a fiery exchange with Joan Ramsey.
Fiona's choices rattle a decades-long truce between the Salem witches and Marie Laveau; the Council of Witchcraft pays a surprise visit to the academy with disturbing allegations.
Besieged by Marie Laveau's army, Zoe unleashes a new power; Fiona and Myrtle clash over control of the coven; Madame LaLaurie is confronted by old ghosts.
Zoe, Queenie and Nan make contact with a dark spirit trapped in the academy; Cordelia's new power brings on a heartbreaking revelation.
Fiona finds purpose in a dangerous love affair; Queenie questions her place in the Coven; Cordelia makes a decision about her mother.
Cordelia rallies the girls in the fight to stop Fiona; a dangerous new enemy puts Misty in the cross hairs; the rivalry between Marie Laveau and Delphine comes to a head.
Cordelia’s attacker is revealed. Fiona looks to form an alliance with Marie Laveau. Nan learns a disturbing truth about Luke’s past.

Episode.EpisodeName: The Magical Delights of Stevie Nicks
Episode.Overview: Fiona attempts to out the new supreme with a visit from Stevie Nicks; Cordelia learns the truth about Hank and the witch hunters; Madison tries to eliminate her competition for the supremacy.
Fiona and Laveau have a deadly face off with The Corporation; Cordelia makes a desperate sacrifice.
Cordelia's latest vision puts the coven's future in question; the girls manifest powerful new gifts; Queenie's search for Marie Laveau leads her to hell and back.
A new Supreme rises.
